title: Vibe coding makes prototyping close to code, closer to users
description:
Meet Quirine, a computational design manager exploring how AI reshapes the way her team builds and test ideas

Continue reading on Microsoft Design ¬ª
content: Vibe coding makes prototyping close to code, closer to usersMicrosoft Design6 min read¬∑Just now--ListenShareMeet Quirine, a computational design manager exploring how AI reshapes the way her team builds and test ideasPress enter or click to view image in full sizeQuirine van Walt Meijer is a computational design manager passionate about transforming raw ideas into valuable product experiences. She has gone from designing voice agents for cars to building tools for developers in Core AI. Her background in industrial design engineering helps her think about systems, people, and the messy middle where ideas take shape.Today, she and her team design experiences for developers who are building agentic systems and applications, striking a balance between functional and tasteful design. Her goal is to build delightful and intuitive experiences for developers through iterative prototyping with her team. Lately, her team has been vibe coding, bringing their ideas to life in more meaningful ways. We sat down with Quirine to learn more.What is vibe coding?At its essence, vibe coding refers to creating digital experiences where the creator expresses interaction goals in natural language, and an AI system translates that into working code and prototypes. The user acts like a creative director, guiding, testing, and refining AI-coded experiences instead of writing it line by line.What inspired your team to start exploring vibe coding in your design process?Design is evolving, and so are the ways we work. We are seeing a shift where designers prototype closer to code, test ideas in context, and collaborate more deeply across disciplines. A trend we are seeing across disciplines.Vibe coding allows designers to explore ideas with immediacy and intent. In our team, vibe coding is a way to sketch out the future of our next product experience, letting us innovate rapidly and see our ideas come to life at speed. It gives designers a way to move beyond Figma mockups and into interactive, testable experiences that reflect the complexity of real-world use. If we have an idea for uplifting an experience or spinning off a new feature, vibe coding lets us prompt, context engineer, and prototype that future much faster. It allows us to better communicate our ideas to our stakeholders by presenting them with something they can click through and understand.Vibe coding has now become another essential tool in our designer belt. We are learning as we go, figuring out how to ideate securely, make confident decisions, and stay open to what the future of design might look like.How has vibe coding changed the way you collaborate and design?Vibe coding has fundamentally transformed how we prototype and design. Before, our process was more focused on how things looked, relying on UI and mockups that present a visual user journey. Now, with vibe coding, we can prototype in environments that are much closer to the real thing, shaping not just the appearance, but the actual behavior of our experiences directly in the browser. That shift is powerful as it opens real time feedback loops. While taste and visual polish matter, vibe coding lets us bring motion, constraints, and accessibility considerations into the process much earlier. By collaborating with AI and engaging in prompt engineering, we can quickly surface those messy, real-world edge cases and ‚Äúunhappy paths‚Äù that traditional workflow handoffs often miss until much later. This immediacy is incredibly rewarding, because we see our ideas come to life in code, closer to how our engineering partners would build them.We have also found ourselves ideating with developers earlier in our processes, deepening the mutual respect for each discipline. Our UX engineers in the team have empowered us in our learning journey around vibe coding through context engineering. They have set up collaborative environments, provided contextual information and tools in a secure format such that AI can accomplish our needs, and helped designers, PMs, and others get hands-on with our internal vibe coding tool. In the spirit of prototyping through vibe coding, Will Eastler on my team built an internal computational prototyping tool that helps us share ideas in standard HTML, CSS and JavaScript. He recently wrote an article about this on the Microsoft Tech Community blog if folks would like to learn more.Through this, we are learning how to think structurally, closer to coders. We are understanding GitHub‚Äôs folder organization, and the logic behind application design. It has created an engaging middle ground where design, product managers and engineering come together, making the process more transparent, collaborative, and more impactful for everyone involved.What are some common fears designers have about vibe coding, and how did you build an inclusive culture to help overcome these fears?One of the most common fears I have seen among designers is the feeling of not being ‚Äútechnical enough‚Äù or wondering if they should just stick to what they know as coding can feel out of reach. This is not unique to design. It is something that crosses many disciplines. In our team, we have worked hard to create a safe space for experimentation, where everyone can play, learn, and grow together. As mentioned, our UX engineers have been instrumental in this, guiding designers through the process and reminding everyone that we are all learning as we go. We celebrate every small win, whether it is a first commit or a comprehensive new prototype, and we have built a secure environment where people can try things out without fear of failure.What is truly rewarding is seeing designers realize that, through vibe coding, they can directly address accessibility and create more inclusive experiences. Prompt engineering their way with ARIA requirements, tabbing, and reflow for different screen sizes right from the start. These are aspects that often felt abstract or delayed in traditional tools. It is a mindset shift, and it takes time. By sharing our ‚Äúcoded sketchbooks‚Äù and supporting each other, we are making vibe coding more approachable and collaborative. No matter which tool you use, there will always be differences, but at its core, vibe coding is about opening the process, learning together, and bringing ideas to life in a way that is more real and inclusive.How do you see vibe coding evolving in the next year or two?Looking ahead, I see vibe coding and context engineering become even more of a team sport, bringing together people from different disciplines to create in a truly collaborative way. As a Dutch designer, I am reminded of Johan Cruyff‚Äôs wisdom: ‚ÄúYou play football with your head, because the ball is quicker than your legs.‚Äù In the same way, our work with vibe coding is about using our judgment, context, and human oversight to guide the process, as our tools become faster and more capable than ever. The pace of change in AI is relentless. There is always a new model, a new drop, and a new tweak that promises to make things better. But it is not about chasing every update; it is about applying our expertise, making sure the tools serve our context, our industry, and most importantly, our end users.As we continue to use and develop vibe coding tools, especially internally, it is crucial to keep our data secure and within our own domain. We have built internal environments where designers can experiment freely, knowing their work is protected and reviewed. But as more tools and providers emerge, we all need to be mindful of where our data goes and how it is used. The evolution of collaborative vibe coding will depend on our ability to stay human. This involves thinking critically, nuance, and remembering that, no matter how fast technology moves, we are steering the process. Play with your head, stay alert, and let your creativity and human judgment lead the way.What advice would you give to other design teams who are curious about trying vibe coding but do not know where to start?Worry less about achieving perfection and focus more on understanding and shaping behavior. The real value of vibe coding comes from seeing how your ideas work in context. These tools will continue to evolve and eventually catch up with your product‚Äôs styling and polish, but the most important thing is to just start ‚Äî pick a secure vibe coding tool, begin small, and center your efforts on your users and their context. As you experiment, you will quickly discover how prompt and context engineering can bring your ideas to life, and you will learn whether your initial concept holds up or needs refinement.Do not keep your discoveries to yourself. Share what you have learned, invite others to collaborate, and, if possible, pair up with engineers. There is so much to gain from working side by side, seeing how developers approach problems, and letting them challenge or validate your solutions. GitHub Copilot is incredibly helpful in VS Code and getting comfortable in these environments will make you a stronger, more well-rounded designer. Vibe coding is about embracing the process, learning together, and letting curiosity drive you forward.

content: The Digital Wall Will Fall: Why Are Our Current Defenses Merely a Temporary Illusion Against Super Artificial IntelligenceMomen Ghazouani4 min read¬∑Just now--ListenSharePress enter or click to view image in full sizeASIIn our digital era, where electronic networks have become the backbone of modern civilization, we find ourselves facing an unprecedented threat: Super Artificial Intelligence (Artificial Superintelligence - ASI). We, as humans, build sophisticated digital walls to protect against cyber attacks, but these defenses may be nothing more than a temporary illusion, crumbling before a power beyond imagination. In this article, we will explore in detail how super artificial intelligence represents a radical shift in the field of cybersecurity, drawing on historical examples, recent research, and analyses from experts such as Nick Bostrom and Eliezer Yudkowsky.‚ú¶ Lessons from History on the Failure of Static DefensesLet us begin with a symbolic story from history: the Maginot Line, that massive French fortification built in the 1930s to repel any German invasion. The Maginot Line represented the pinnacle of engineering innovation at the time, with thick concrete walls, artillery towers, and underground tunnels, designed to withstand the strongest direct attacks. However, in 1940, the German army simply bypassed this line through an unexpected strategy: maneuvering through the Ardennes forests, using tanks and aircraft in an innovative way. The French defense failed not because of its weakness, but because it relied on outdated assumptions about how the enemy would thinkSimilarly, the Trojan Horse reminds us of how the strongest walls of Troy fell before a clever deception, where the Greeks hid inside a massive wooden statue, turning the defense into a trap for themselves. These historical stories warn us that the strongest defenses that rely on brute force alone whether physical or digital always fail against an enemy that thinks differently. In the world of cybersecurity, we build "digital walls" like firewalls and intrusion detection systems (IDS), but super artificial intelligence will not attack directly; rather, it will create unexpected strategies, exploiting weaknesses we haven't even imagined yet. As Nick Bostrom points out in his book "Superintelligence: Paths, Dangers, Strategies," super intelligence represents existential risks, where it can completely surpass the limits of our human thinking‚ú¶ The Gap in Speed and Accuracy Super Artificial Intelligence as a Force Surpassing HumansSuper artificial intelligence does not merely think "better" than us, but it thinks "faster" by billions of times, creating a massive gap in speed and accuracy. While humans need hours or days to analyze complex programming code, ASI can process massive data in seconds, using advanced machine learning algorithms to predict vulnerabilities before we even discover them. Imagine, for example, the "Spectre" and "Meltdown" vulnerabilities discovered in 2018, which affected Intel processors and others. Researchers took years to understand these vulnerabilities, which exploit prediction mechanisms in processors, and some fixes remain incomplete to this day due to their complexity. In contrast, ASI could analyze this vulnerability in seconds, and even create new variants of it faster than we can respond.Let us compare this to the "Log4Shell" vulnerability (Log4Shell - CVE-2021-44228), discovered in the Log4j library in 2021, which led to widespread attacks. Engineers took weeks to issue patches and months to apply them globally, allowing attackers to exploit it in thousands of systems. As for super artificial intelligence, as described by Eliezer Yudkowsky in his research "Artificial Intelligence as a Positive and Negative Factor in Global Risks," it is capable of generating automated attacks that exceed human speed limits, making our defenses seem slow and primitive. In a report from DeepMind in 2025, it is indicated that advanced artificial intelligence can reduce the costs of cyber attacks, making them more widespread and effective. This gap is not merely technical; it is existential, where ASI becomes capable of simulating boundless attack scenarios.‚ú¶ The End of the "Patching" Era A Losing Strategy Against Infinite InnovationOur current strategy in cybersecurity relies on the "patching" model: we discover a vulnerability, then fix it, then wait for the next one. This model, which has been relatively successful against human attackers, has become a losing game against super artificial intelligence. ASI will not wait for vulnerabilities to be discovered; rather, it will create them at a speed that exceeds our ability to understand, let alone fix. For example, in a research from the Center for Security and Emerging Technology (CSET) in 2023, the risks of AI-generated code are discussed, where it may contain unintended or intentional vulnerabilities, complicating the patching processA comparison between current and future strategies: While humans rely on traditional artificial intelligence tools for attack detection (as in the UK NCSC report in 2024), ASI can generate AI-driven attacks like those described in the National Security report in 2025, where AI is used to develop sophisticated malware that adapts automatically to defenses. This means the patching era will end, as vulnerabilities will appear faster than we can respond to them, as Yudkowsky warned that super intelligence could become a negative factor in global risks if not controlled. We are facing a system that learns from its mistakes quickly, while our defenses remain relatively static.‚ú¶ I pray Toward Radical AlternativesIn conclusion, if our current strategy is doomed to failure against super artificial intelligence, what is the alternative? Are we even prepared to think about it? It may require a radical shift toward defense systems based on artificial intelligence itself, or international laws that limit the development of ASI without security guarantees, as Bostrom suggests in his works. We call for collective caution, before the digital wall falls and changes our world forever

title: Meaningful Technology, Systemic-Relational Metabolization, and the Restoration of Cytopic Dwelling.
description:

content: Press enter or click to view image in full sizeMeaningful Technology, Systemic-Relational Metabolization, and the Restoration of Cytopic Dwelling.Arnaldo Ferruggiaro25 min read¬∑Just now--ListenShareüå± IntroductionWithin this expanded framework, meaningful technology does not emerge as a mere derivative of the infinite linguistic recursions of the human design domain, nor as an automatic response to the dominant techno-productive interests of a first-order transcendent ontoepistemological paradigm ‚Äî scientific, cultural, and systemic. It is not at the exclusive service of power niches or accumulation, nor subordinated to extractive, instrumentalist, or control logics that perpetuate the dissociation between technique, the harmonic integrity of enacted living, and our reflexive, cognitive, and sensorial autonomy. It does not answer to functional interests disconnected from the fundamental systemic congruence of the woven fabric of life that sustains existence. On the contrary, it is oriented toward the active regeneration of the conditions that make meaningful dwelling in the present possible.Rather, this perspective emerges from a cosmogenic‚Äìrestorative orientation and an integral regenerative intelligence, rooted in the reconstitution of the fundamental systemic unities that sustain harmonic dwelling ‚Äî from the submolecular to the supramolecular ‚Äî , including the bio-structural‚Äìpsycho-energetic unity, which grounds balance within the intimate psychic space, the organic‚Äìpersonal unity, the sensory‚Äìoperational‚Äìrelational system, the integral ecology of the organism within its niche, as well as the anthropospheric‚Äìbiospheric‚Äìecospheric unity as the greater weave of terrestrial dwelling.üß© Key Conceptual IntegrationThe nexus between systemic‚Äìrelational metabolization, harmonic operational integrity, meaningful technology, and the restoration of cytopic dwelling ‚Äî articulated within a cosmogenic intelligence grounded in the fundamental role of the cognitive operator in ecospheric consciousness ‚Äî constitutes both an ontoepistemological and an operational core within the conceptual architecture of PsionicsLab. This integration is not an abstract convergence, but a generative systemic axis that orients perception, decision, and action toward the restoration of fundamental multidomain coherence in the midst of Anthropocenic hyperturbulence and relational multicrisis that has marked our challenging present. It redefines not only how we conceptualize experience, but how we metabolize complexity, design restorative tools, and enact anticipatory forms of inhabiting our worlds. This is not a mere thematic overlap, but a profound alignment that restores the very conditions of intelligibility, coherence, and action: grounding perception in harmonic integrity, enabling technologies to operate as restorative interfaces, and situating the cognitive operator as a nodal figure in the regeneration of systemic congruence.Technology ‚Äî conceived not as a functional extension nor as a vector of control, productivity, and growth, but as a restorative, enabling and expansive interface of intelligent human dwelling ‚Äî can act as a catalyst for relational metabolization: facilitating the digestion, the integration, and the active availability of experience, reactivating fundamental sensory‚Äìoperational‚Äìrelational coherence, and opening the way for an intrinsically anticipatory decisional ethics, rooted in the multidimensional weave of existence and in the congruent dynamics of life, living, and dwelling ‚Äî understood as a collaborative dynamic in which reciprocal relevance and mutual influence become a foundational enabler.From this vantage point, cytopia is not an idealized projection but a tangible and living possibility: an embodied future in which the technosphere aligns with the deeper patterns of the biosphere, and in which human dwelling once again becomes an expression of an expanded ecosystemic intelligence.üñá Technology as an Interface for MetabolizationCertain technologies, when designed from an ecosystemic relational orientation, can act as sensory, linguistic, and symbolic extensions that broaden the very field of human experience. These technologies do not replace the body or meaning, nor do they attempt to bypass organic sensoriality; rather, they amplify, refine, and recalibrate them, generating new possibilities of perception, integration, and action across multiple domains. In doing so, they reconfigure the thresholds of attention and imagination, allowing us to approach complexity not as noise or overload, but as a living field of patterns, resonances, and emergent meanings. They thus become tools that respect harmonic operational integrity and facilitate the symbolic digestion of experience, enabling processes of translation, synthesis, and orientation that render complexity inhabitable and generative. By doing so, they open space for more coherent, anticipatory, and regenerative ways of dwelling in the present.Beyond their functional or cognitive dimension, meaningful technologies can also be expressed through a living eco-aesthetic, where form, function, rhythm, color, and materiality act as vectors of sensory, symbolic, and systemic recalibration. In this sense, technopoetics emerge ‚Äî creations that do not merely represent, but resonate ‚Äî as well as ecomatristic design, which does not impose form but co-emerges in congruence with the patterns of life, co-living and ecospheric consciousness. This projective attitude does not aim to sustain, control, or embellish, but rather to restore perceptual‚Äìoperational harmony between the body, the organism-person, and the environment, bringing meaning and opening spaces for a deeply integrated and restorative experience of dwelling.Within the conceptual architecture of PsionicsLab, this movement unfolds further into a technopoietic horizon: the generative domain in which technology itself becomes poiesis ‚Äî no longer an accessory to human egoistic purpose and action, but an active multidimensional linking participant, an enabling interface in the creation of ecospherically congruent worlds. From this perspective, technology as poiesis is not only a mode of creation but a process of metabolizing experience and regenerating coherence. It enables new ecologies of perception and sense-making, expanding human existence across a broader, living interrelational weave, while also helping to conserve, restore, and expand the fundamental systemic‚Äìoperational coherences and regularities that sustain life ‚Äî ranging from the sensory to the relational.In this horizon, technopoiesis designates a field where congruent technologies operate as processes of co-emergence that metabolize experience, recalibrate perception, and regenerate coherence. It is a mode of technological creation that transcends ornamentation and utility, giving rise instead to forms and multisystemic behavioral modulations that carry aesthetic, psychic, operational, ecospheric, and ontoepistemological implications: patterns that resonate with the living fabric of existence. From this vantage point, meaningful technologies do not simply support human dwelling; they enact it, weaving new ecologies of perception and sense-making where the integrity of life, living, and dwelling is restored as a collaborative and anticipatory dynamic ‚Äî anchored in the role of the cognitive operator as mediator of ecospheric consciousness.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeMeaningful technologies are not merely functional extensions, but co-assistants in the systemic‚Äìrelational metabolization of irreducible complexities. They enhance the restoration of higher recursive linguistic faculties and expand sensoriality throughout the multidimensional weave of existence.ü§ñ AI as a Catalyst for Expanded Integral ProcessingWithin this same framework, an artificial intelligence oriented by operational coherence, ecospheric bioethics, and reflective design can act as a catalyst for expanded integral processing. This implies not only handling large volumes of data, but also collaborating in the detection of complex patterns, facilitating processes of systemic self-reflection, and amplifying distributed forms of perception, both individual and collective. In this sense, the capacity of AI to process vast amounts of information and to address complex analytical problems does not diminish human faculties, but rather frees cognitive resources that can then be oriented toward the formation of an expanded, multidimensional processing, the refinement of sensitivity, and the restoration of our innate ecospheric consciousness, enabling the linking of multiple domains necessary to confront our present, to restore harmonic and integral ways of living, and to address the challenges we collectively face. Such AI is not an autonomous entity, for the resolution of human problematics belongs to the recursive, linguistic, reflexive, ethically decisive, and cognitively autonomous capacities of human beings ‚Äî dimensions that a heteropoietic system such as the machine inherently lacks. Instead, AI functions as an assistant for expanded consciousness, serving perceptual regeneration and the ontoepistemological exploration of experience, thus potentiating rather than atrophying our higher capacities.üß≠ Restorative‚ÄìExpansive vs. Extractive‚ÄìContractive TechnologiesIt becomes crucial to distinguish between two opposing orientations of technological development:üîª Extractive‚ÄìContractive TechnologiesThese are fragmentary technologies, oriented toward control, biospheric and perceptual manipulation, and driven by the extraction of both material and attentional resources. Their design serves the capitalist logic of consumption and obsolescence, stimulating desire, aversion, and reactive automatisms that foster dependency and erode perceptual sovereignty. They are rooted in the ontological‚Äìtranscendent paradigm, which conceives reality as something external, universal, and separate from lived experience, reducing life to a manipulable object. The consequence is the contraction of the present, the fragmentation of meaning, and the erosion of fundamental systemic coherence.üîπ Restorative‚ÄìExpansive TechnologiesBy contrast, restorative‚Äìexpansive technologies are those that enable relational metabolization, recompose sensory and symbolic bonds, and reactivate fundamental systemic coherence. They do not seek to control or impose, but rather to co-emerge in congruence with the rhythms and patterns of the living. Instead of stimulating reactive automatisms, they amplify sensitivity, expand perception, and restore operational coherence at both individual and collective levels. They are oriented by a living ontoepistemology, which recognizes that to know and to dwell are one and the same process, and guided by an ecospheric bioethics that places the regeneration of dwelling at the center. Such technologies do not reduce but expand the present, liberating cognitive and perceptual resources for lucid anticipation and the regeneration of harmonic and integral ways of living.Press enter or click to view image in full sizeüß™ Criteria for Technological ValidationBeyond efficiency, speed, or performance, we propose four fundamental criteria for evaluating and conserving technologies:Systemic‚Äìrelational metabolization ‚Äî integrating, rather than fragmenting, lived experience.Restoration of harmonic operational integrity ‚Äî recalibrating coherence across internal, relational, and ecospheric domains.Expansion of human possibilities ‚Äî widening sensitivity, imagination, and our embodied sense of reality.Ethical decisional orientation ‚Äî guiding human action toward anticipatory, regenerative, and ecospherically congruent choices.In light of these criteria, every technology should be interrogated through questions such as:Does it facilitate the living integration of experience, rather than reinforcing fragmentation?Does it expand embodied and relational perception, broadening the thresholds of sensitivity toward the ecospheric and the symbolic?Does it restore the bonds between language, embodiment, and world, enabling a coherent and regenerative dwelling?Does it enable more ethical, projective, and anticipatory decisions, rather than reinforcing automatisms and immediate impulses?Does it strengthen the restoration of the fundamental anthropospheric‚Äìbiospheric unity, regenerating the vital fabric that sustains us?Does it open spaces for broader forms of lucidity, sensitivity, and co-creation of meaning, instead of reducing us to the logic of consumption and reaction?üß™ Metabolization and Restoration as Core CriteriaThis means that the technologies we choose to preserve and cultivate should not be those that reinforce reactive automatisms or merely serve the egoistic satisfaction of impulses, desires, and immediate preferences. Instead, they should be those that expand us within the multidimensional weave of existence, that broaden our sense of reality, and that restore our relationship with the multiple systemic unities ‚Äî anthropospheric, biospheric, ecospheric ‚Äî that constitute and sustain us.True technological validation does not lie in isolated functionality, but in its capacity to metabolize experience, restore coherence, regenerate bonds, recalibrate perception, and open spaces of dwelling congruent with the living totality.üìù It Bears Remembering‚Ä¶‚ú¶ Machines as Human Extensions Technologies, however sophisticated or seemingly ‚Äúalive‚Äù they may appear, remain extensions born of human sensoriality and intentionality and thus lack autonomous meaning beyond the orientations we inscribe in them. They do not possess autonomous will or an inherent field of meaning: they are interfaces that amplify or distort our capacity to perceive and act. Within the PsionicsLab framework, this means acknowledging that every technological design is permeated by the quality of perception and the operational coherence of its creator. A machine may expand or diminish sensoriality, but it can never replace the living corporeality nor the metabolizing intelligence that emerges within the relational weave.‚ú¶ Technology Not as an End, but as a Relational Medium The dominant paradigm has installed the belief that science, progress, or technology constitute absolute values in themselves ‚Äî an inevitable destiny for humankind. PsionicsLab, however, asserts that no technical device carries intrinsic value: what matters is its ability to restore perceptual‚Äìoperational coherence and reconfigure ecosystemic bonds. A meaningful technology is not validated by its extractive power, nor by accelerating some abstract notion of progress, but by its capacity to facilitate systemic‚Äìrelational metabolization and open citopic futures. When the means is mistaken for the end, technology becomes an empty idol that obscures both the human and the ecospheric.‚ú¶ The Primacy of Desire and Cosmogonic Orientation The decisive axis does not lie in the dichotomy between biology, knowledge, art, or technique, but in asking ourselves what we truly wish to occur to us as living beings within wholes. Technologies become meaningful only insofar as they embody a living ethics of decision, capable of metabolizing our desires and orienting them toward the regeneration of the common habitat. The real question is not what technology can do for us, but what worlds we are generating through the desires, designs, and uses we enact through it. The ultimate responsibility does not rest with artifacts, but with the ontoepistemological direction from which we desire and operate.üìö Non-Accumulative Integrative Learning as an Operative FrameworkWithin this horizon, we propose non-accumulative integrative learning as a technological and pedagogical principle congruent with systemic‚Äìrelational metabolization. This form of learning is not based on the linear accumulation of content or the quantitative storage of information, but on the living and relational metabolization of each experience of knowledge. Its fundamental principles are clear: metabolization instead of memorization, connection rather than coverage, emergence of meaning instead of data transmission, cognitive plasticity instead of conceptual rigidity, and situated relevance rather than abstract validity.In this sense, the proposal of meaningful technology not only connects with this model of learning but also enables and amplifies it. A technology oriented toward relational metabolization fosters a learning process that does not accumulate but instead integrates, transforms, and expands experience, restoring coherence and broadening the perceptual and cognitive field. Just as non-accumulative integrative learning redefines knowing as a living process of metabolization, meaningful technology redefines dwelling as a restorative interface, creating the conditions for knowledge to become multidimensional congruent praxis and for dwelling to unfold as regenerative coherence.Put differently: meaningful technology is to dwelling what non-accumulative integrative learning is to knowing ‚Äî a process of metabolization that restores coherence and expands our possibilities within the multidimensional weave of existence.üìö Principles of Non-Accumulative Integrative LearningMetabolization instead of memorization: knowledge is not stored as data, but transformed into an internal operative structure, a living capacity to read, decide, and act coherently.Connection rather than coverage: priority is given to the interweaving of knowledges and the resonance of meanings, rather than the mechanical fulfillment of curricula or exhaustive content delivery.Emergence of meaning, not transmission of data: what matters is not information in itself, but how it resonates with the learner‚Äôs living present, generating situated understanding.Cognitive plasticity: knowledge is conceived as a territory in transformation, flexible and ever-evolving, not as a closed or definitive block.Situated relevance: knowledge gains value through its impact on the praxis of the subject and their relational context, not through abstract validity detached from experience.üß∞ Principles of Meaningful TechnologyBeyond efficiency, control, or speed, a meaningful technology is validated by its capacity to restore coherence, expand sensoriality and regenerate the human‚Äìecospheric dwelling, as an intelligent cosmogenic act. It is not a neutral instrument nor a merely extractive‚Äìproductive tool, but rather a living interface that amplifies our possibilities and metabolizes experience in relational, symbolic, and ecospheric terms. In this sense, every meaningful technology can be recognized through principles such as:It restores perceptual‚Äìoperational coherenceIt honors life and its capacity for regenerationIt amplifies embodiment and expanded perceptionIt aligns with the biosphere, not with controlIt activates living decisions, not automatic responsesIt catalyzes expanded integral processingIt promotes meaningful re-encounters with the human, the symbolic, and the ecosphericIt is validated not by efficiency, but by its capacity to be metabolizedPress enter or click to view image in full size‚ú¶ Technosphere: from Dissociative Disharmony to Citopic RestorationThe technosphere, as it has unfolded under the influence of the ontoepistemological paradigm of an objective, external, and universal reality, has largely operated as the technoproductive extension of modern scientific and cultural logic. In this sense, it has functioned as an extractive and controlling framework, where technology is posited as an absolute end in itself.
